intro: Campylospermum thwaitesii, commonly known as the broadleaf senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous traits and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves with numerous leaflets. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters, while the seeds are enclosed in a hairy pod. It plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitats.
